https://www.eatingwell.com/brussels-spro.Title: Brussels Sprouts, Kale & Pear Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/brussels-spro.Description: This crisp and colorful salad celebrates the best of cool-weather produce, including Brussels sprouts, kale, pears and pomegranate seeds.
Ingredients: 2 small cloves garlic, grated (about ¼ teaspoon)
1 medium bunch kale, stemmed and chopped (about 10 cups)
10 ounces Brussels sprouts, trimmed and thinly sliced (about 4 cups)
Instructions: Whisk 4 tablespoons vinegar, 1½ tablespoons maple syrup, 2 teaspoons mustard, ½ teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon pepper and the grated garlic together in a large bowl. While whisking, gradually add 5 tablespoons oil; whisk until emulsified.
Add chopped kale and sliced Brussels sprouts to the bowl. Massage the mixture with clean hands until the kale is bright green and reduced in volume by about half, about 1 minute.
Add pear slices, ½ cup pomegranate arils, the chopped walnuts and ¾ cup Parmesan; toss to combine. Top with the remaining ¼ cup Parmesan.

https://www.eatingwell.com/orange-peach-.Title: Orange-Peach Chia Seed Smoothie
https://www.eatingwell.com/orange-peach-.Description: This smoothie is a bright way to start your day. Sweet oranges and frozen peaches are blended with Greek-style yogurt and sweetened naturally by Medjool dates.
Ingredients: ½ cup whole-milk plain strained (Greek-style) yogurt
¼ cup chopped pitted Medjool dates (about 3 dates)
Instructions: Combine 1 cup orange juice, ½ cup yogurt, 2 cups orange segments, 1 cup peaches, ¼ cup chopped dates, 2 tablespoons chia seeds, ½ teaspoon vanilla and ⅛ teaspoon salt in a blender. Blend on high speed until smooth, about 1 minute. Divide between 2 glasses.

https://www.eatingwell.com/roasted-cauli.Title: Roasted Cauliflower Salad with Lemon-Shallot Vinaigrette
https://www.eatingwell.com/roasted-cauli.Description: This roasted cauliflower salad with lemon-shallot vinaigrette is an easy side dish that can be served warm or at room temperature.
Ingredients: 2 small heads cauliflower, cut into 1-inch florets (about 6 cups)
2 cups chopped butternut squash (about ¾-inch pieces)
Instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F. Toss cauliflower florets, 2 cups squash, 1 tablespoon oil, ¼ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper on a large rimmed baking sheet until evenly coated.
Roast until the vegetables are tender and browned in some spots, about 15 minutes.

Meanwhile, combine 2 tablespoons shallot, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 tablespoon vinegar, 1 teaspoon honey, 1 teaspoon mustard and the remaining 2 tablespoons oil, ¼ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper in a small bowl; whisk well.
Place 2 cups arugula and the roasted vegetables in a large serving bowl; toss to combine. Top with ¼ cup goat cheese and 2 tablespoons chopped pecans. Drizzle with the vinaigrette.

https://www.eatingwell.com/roasted-cauli.Title: Roasted Cauliflower Salad with Lemon-Garlic Vinaigrette
https://www.eatingwell.com/roasted-cauli.Description: This roasted cauliflower salad is a flavorful side dish that pairs with just about anything. he cauliflower is roasted alongside sweet bell pepper until golden.
Ingredients: 1 small red bell pepper, sliced (about 1 cup)
2 packed cups spring mix salad greens
¼ cup chopped mixed fresh tender herbs (such as mint, dill and/or flat-leaf parsley)
3 ounces feta in brine, cubed (½-inch, about ⅔ cup), divided
Instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F. Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.

Toss 6 cups cauliflower, the sliced bell pepper, 1 tablespoon oil, ¼ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper together in a large bowl until well coated. Spread in an even layer on the prepared baking sheet. Roast until the cauliflower is just tender and golden brown in some spots, about 20 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes.

Meanwhile, whisk 2 tablespoons lemon juice, the grated garlic, 2 teaspoons honey, ½ teaspoon mustard and the remaining 4 tablespoons oil, ¼ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper together in a small bowl until emulsified.

Transfer the roasted cauliflower mixture to a large serving bowl; add 2 cups salad greens, ½ cup onion, ¼ cup chopped herbs and ⅓ cup feta. Drizzle with vinaigrette just before serving; toss to combine, then top with the remaining ⅓ cup feta.

https://www.eatingwell.com/one-pan-chick.Title: One-Pan Chicken Florentine
https://www.eatingwell.com/one-pan-chick.Description: Classic chicken Florentine—creamy spinach served alongside sautéed chicken—is a fast and easy meal. Plus it’s made in one pan for quick cleanup.
Instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season sliced chicken with ¼ teaspoon each salt and pepper. Add to the pan and cook, turning once, until just cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to a plate and tent with foil to keep warm.

Reduce heat to medium. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, ¼ cup shallot and the minced garlic to the pan. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add ⅓ cup wine, scraping up any browned bits. Add 1 pound baby spinach in batches; cook, stirring often, until wilted, 3 to 5 minutes.

In a measuring cup, whisk ⅓ cup cream, 2 teaspoons cornstarch and the remaining ¼ teaspoon each salt and pepper. Add to the pan with the spinach; cook, stirring frequently, until thickened, about 2 minutes. Serve with the chicken.

https://www.eatingwell.com/kale-pineappl.Title: This Kale-Pineapple Drink Is Packed with Potassium to Support Healthy Blood Pressure
https://www.eatingwell.com/kale-pineappl.Description: This refreshing tropical kale-pineapple juice shows just how versatile kale can be. Blanching the greens softens their bitterness and preserves the color.
Ingredients: 2 large curly kale leaves, stemmed and torn into large pieces (about 2 cups)
Instructions: Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil over high heat. Prepare a bowl of ice water; place near the stove. Add torn kale to the boiling water; cook just until vibrant green and tender, 1 to 2 minutes. Using a spider or slotted spoon, transfer the kale to the ice bath. Let stand until cooled, about 2 minutes. Drain well and gently squeeze with your hands to remove excess liquid.
Transfer the blanched kale to a blender. Add 1½ cups pineapple and 1½ cups coconut water. Blend until completely smooth, about 1 minute.
If desired, fill 2 glasses with ice. Pour the juice into the glasses and serve. Recipe developed by Jasmine Smith

https://www.eatingwell.com/focaccia-sand.Title: These Focaccia Sandwiches Will Transport You to Italy
https://www.eatingwell.com/focaccia-sand.Description: From a tomato-mozzarella version to a fig and goat cheese version, these Italian-inspired focaccia sandwiches are an easy lunch idea.
Ingredients: 1 (8.5-ounce) loaf focaccia, cut into 4 pieces, sliced horizontally and toasted
4 (0.5-ounce) slices cured meat, such as prosciutto, salami or capicola
1 (8.5-ounce) loaf focaccia, cut into 4 pieces, sliced horizontally and toasted
4 (0.5-ounce) slices cured meat, such as prosciutto, salami or capicola
Instructions: To make Tomato, Mozzarella & Pesto Sandwich: Place toasted focaccia slices on a cutting board. Spread 1½ teaspoons pesto on 4 focaccia slices. Top each with 1 slice meat and 1 slice mozzarella. Top evenly with sliced tomatoes. Drizzle each with 1 teaspoon balsamic glaze. Top each with a remaining focaccia slice. Cut in half and serve.

To make Fig & Goat Cheese Sandwich: Place toasted focaccia slices on a cutting board. Divide 3 ounces goat cheese among 4 focaccia slices; spread to cover. Top each with 1½ teaspoons fig jam. Top each with 1 slice meat and ¼ cup arugula. Drizzle each with ½ teaspoon balsamic glaze. Top each with a remaining focaccia slice. Cut in half and serve.

https://www.eatingwell.com/high-protein-.Title: This Creamy Orange-Mango Flaxseed Shake Delivers 17 Grams of Protein
https://www.eatingwell.com/high-protein-.Description: Bright, creamy and packed with staying power, this protein shake blends juicy mandarin, tropical mango and tangy strained yogurt into a sunshine-hued drink.
Ingredients: 1 large mandarin or clementine orange (6½ ounces), peeled, plus slices for garnish
Instructions: Combine 1 peeled orange, 1 cup mango, 1¼ cups yogurt, ½ cup ice, ½ cup water, 3 tablespoons ground flaxseed and ½ teaspoon vanilla in a blender. Blend until smooth, about 1 minute.
Divide the shake between 2 tall glasses. Garnish with orange slices, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/marry-me-whit.Title: Marry Me White Bean Soup
https://www.eatingwell.com/marry-me-whit.Description: This Marry Me White Bean Soup borrows inspiration from the beloved Marry Me Chicken recipe with a combination of sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, cream and Parmesan.
Ingredients: 1 medium yellow onion, finely chopped (about 1 cup)
½ cup chopped drained julienne-cut sun-dried tomatoes in oil with herbs
2 (15-ounce) cans no-salt-added white beans (such as great northern or cannellini), rinsed
Instructions: Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add chopped onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 3 minutes. Add chopped garlic, 1 teaspoon oregano, ½ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper; cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 20 seconds. Add ½ cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes; cook, stirring, until slightly darkened, about 2 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon lemon juice; stir until absorbed, about 20 seconds.

Stir in rinsed beans and 4 cups broth. Bring to a lively simmer over medium-high heat. Stir in ½ cup cream and 2 tablespoons cream cheese; cook, stirring, until the cream cheese is melted, 2 to 3 minutes.
Add 5 ounces spinach; cook, stirring occasionally, until wilted, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add 1 cup Parmesan; stir until melted.
Divide the soup among 6 bowls. Top with ¼ cup basil and the remaining ¼ cup Parmesan.

https://www.eatingwell.com/20-minute-chi.Title: 20-Minute Chickpea Soup
https://www.eatingwell.com/20-minute-chi.Description: When dinner needs to happen fast, turn to this creamy chickpea soup that's pulled together in just 20 minutes and features chickpeas and sweet potatoes.
Ingredients: 3 large cloves garlic, finely chopped (about 2 tablespoons)
2 small sweet potatoes, scrubbed and chopped (about 2 cups)
Instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large saucepan over high heat. Add chopped onion, chopped garlic, 2 tablespoons taco seasoning and ⅛ teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring often, until fragrant and the onion starts to soften, 3 to 5 minutes.

Stir in 4 cups broth, the rinsed chickpeas, chopped sweet potatoes and diced tomatoes. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to maintain a lively simmer; cook, covered and stirring occasionally, until the sweet potatoes are tender, 8 to 10 minutes.
Stir in the softened cream cheese; return to a lively simmer. Stir in 5 ounces baby spinach; cook until wilted.
Divide the soup among 6 bowls. Garnish with cilantro and tortilla strips, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/turmeric-ging.Title: This Turmeric-Ginger Chia Tonic Is Good for Your Gut
https://www.eatingwell.com/turmeric-ging.Description: This tonic is good for your gut health thanks to the fiber in the chia seeds. Fresh orange juice adds brightness, while ginger and turmeric bring warming spice.
Ingredients: 1 medium navel orange, juiced (about ¼ cup)
1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger (from ½-inch piece)
Instructions: In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine orange juice, 1 teaspoon ginger and 1 teaspoon turmeric. Microwave on High until the mixture is gently simmering, 30 to 45 seconds.

Divide the hot mixture evenly between 2 (12-ounce) heatproof glasses (about 2 tablespoons each). Stir 1 cup cold water and 1 tablespoon chia seeds into each glass. Stir until the chia seeds are suspended in the mixture, about 30 seconds.

https://www.eatingwell.com/two-ingredien.Title: Two-Ingredient Dough
https://www.eatingwell.com/two-ingredien.Description: This dough comes together with two ingredients: self-rising flour and strained, Greek-style yogurt. Use this dough recipe to make pizza, bagels or pretzel bites.
Instructions: To make dough by hand: Place 1¼ cups self-rising flour in a large bowl. Add 1 cup yogurt and stir with a fork until a shaggy dough forms. Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth, about 8 minutes. Add a few tablespoons water if the dough seems dry or a few tablespoons flour if it is sticky.

To make the dough in a stand mixer: Place 1¼ cups self-rising flour in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. Add 1 cup yogurt and mix at low speed until a smooth dough forms, 3 to 4 minutes. Add a few tablespoons water if the dough seems dry or a few tablespoons flour if it is sticky.

To make the dough in a food processor: Place 1¼ cups self-rising flour in a food processor fitted with the steel blade. Add 1 cup yogurt and pulse until a smooth dough forms, about 15 pulses. Add a few tablespoons water if the dough seems dry or a few tablespoons flour if it is sticky.

https://www.eatingwell.com/smashed-green.Title: Smashed Green Beans with Parmesan & Balsamic
https://www.eatingwell.com/smashed-green.Description: These smashed green beans are topped with Parmesan cheese and a drizzle of balsamic glaze for an easy, flavorful side dish.
Instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F with rack in upper third position. Toss trimmed green beans, 1 tablespoon oil, ¼ teaspoon pepper and ⅛ teaspoon salt together on a large rimmed baking sheet until fully coated; arrange in an even layer.
Roast until browned, about 10 minutes. Using a rolling pin or the bottom of a measuring cup, smash the beans.
Combine ⅓ cup Parmesan and 2 tablespoons garlic in a small bowl. Sprinkle over the beans. Roast until the cheese is melted and crisp, 8 to 10 minutes.
Transfer to a large serving platter. Drizzle with 1½ tablespoons balsamic glaze.

https://www.eatingwell.com/broccoli-sala.Title: 15-Minute Broccoli Salad with Feta
https://www.eatingwell.com/broccoli-sala.Description: Bright, crunchy and ready in just 15 minutes, this broccoli salad features bell peppers, cucumbers and feta tossed in a fresh lemony dressing.
Ingredients: ¼ cup lemon juice (from 1 large lemon)
¼ teaspoon ground pepper, plus more for garnish
¾ cup thinly sliced red onion
2 small Persian cucumbers, sliced into half-moons (about 1¼ cups)
Instructions: Whisk ¼ cup lemon juice, ¼ cup oil, the minced garlic, 1 teaspoon oregano, ¼ teaspoon pepper and ¼ teaspoon salt together in a medium serving bowl until well combined.
Add 5 cups broccoli, 1 cup bell pepper, ¾ cup onion and the sliced cucumbers; toss until evenly coated.
Top with ¼ cup feta. Garnish with additional pepper, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/cheesy-bean-t.Title: The 4-Ingredient Breakfast You Should Make on Busy Mornings
https://www.eatingwell.com/cheesy-bean-t.Description: This four-ingredient toast is perfect for using up leftover refried beans. Any salsa works well here, so you can adjust to your spice preferences.
Instructions: Preheat broiler. Place 1 toast slice on a small baking sheet.
Top the toast with ¼ cup warmed refried beans and 1 slice cheese. Broil until the cheese is melted, 1 to 2 minutes. Top with 1 tablespoon salsa.

https://www.eatingwell.com/crispy-smashe.Title: Crispy Smashed Beets with Feta & Pistachios
https://www.eatingwell.com/crispy-smashe.Description: These crispy smashed beets are a flavorful side dish and are topped with tangy feta, crunchy pistachios and a drizzle of honey.
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill or mint
Instructions: Preheat oven to broil with a rack in middle position. Line a large rimmed baking sheet with foil; coat foil with cooking spray.

Slice beets into ½-inch-thick rounds. Pat dry with a paper towel. Transfer the beet rounds to a large bowl; toss with 1 tablespoon cornstarch, ¼ teaspoon pepper and ¼ teaspoon salt until evenly coated. Arrange the beets in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Using the bottom of a Mason jar or sturdy glass, press on each beet to flatten it, but keep it intact. Drizzle the beets evenly with 2 tablespoons oil.
Broil until the edges are crispy and browned, 13 to 16 minutes, rotating the pan front to back halfway through.
Transfer the beets to a serving platter. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon honey; top with ¼ cup feta and 2 tablespoons each pistachios and herbs. Serve warm or at room temperature.

https://www.eatingwell.com/lemon-turmeri.Title: Lemon-Turmeric Cabbage & White Bean Soup
https://www.eatingwell.com/lemon-turmeri.Description: This cozy soup turns humble ingredients into a bowl of golden comfort. Tender cabbage and cannellini beans simmer with aromatic spices for depth.
Instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add 1 cup onion and the sliced carrot; cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. Add minced garlic; cook, stirring occasionally, for 1 minute. Add 4 cups cabbage, 1 teaspoon each turmeric, paprika, dill and salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper; cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. Add 4 cups broth and the rinsed beans; increase heat to high and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to maintain a lively simmer and cook, partially covered, until the vegetables are tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in 2 tablespoons lemon juice.

https://www.eatingwell.com/everything-ba.Title: Everything Bagel Tuna Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/everything-ba.Description: This Everything Bagel Tuna Salad gives the classic lunch a flavorful upgrade. Capers and everything bagel seasoning bring a salty punch that pairs with tuna.
Ingredients: 3 (5-ounce) cans no-salt-added solid white tuna in water, drained and flaked
⅓ cup whole-milk plain strained (Greek-style) yogurt
⅓ cup finely chopped red onion
2 tablespoons no-salt-added everything bagel seasoning, plus more for garnish
Instructions: Stir flaked drained tuna, ⅓ cup each mayonnaise, yogurt and chopped onion, ¼ cup chopped celery, the rinsed capers, 2 tablespoons everything bagel seasoning, 1 tablespoon mustard, 1 tablespoon lemon juice and ¼ teaspoon salt together in a medium bowl until well combined. Garnish with additional everything bagel seasoning, if desired. Recipe developed by Marianne Williams

https://www.eatingwell.com/cabbage-salad.Title: Cabbage Salad with Bacon Is a Quick & Simple Side
https://www.eatingwell.com/cabbage-salad.Description: This warm cabbage salad features crisp, smoky bacon while its rendered drippings are whisked into an apple-cider vinaigrette that coats the cabbage.
Ingredients: 1 small head green cabbage (1½ pounds), shredded (about 9 cups)
Instructions: Cook chopped bacon in a large skillet over medium-low heat, stirring often, until crisp, 12 to 14 minutes. Transfer to a large paper towel-lined plate; reserve bacon grease (you should have about 6 tablespoons; add extra-virgin olive oil to reach that amount if needed).
Whisk 6 tablespoons vinegar, 4 teaspoons mustard, 2 teaspoons honey, ½ teaspoon pepper and ⅛ teaspoon salt in a large bowl. Gradually whisk in the reserved bacon grease.
Add shredded cabbage and the drained bacon; toss until evenly coated.

https://www.eatingwell.com/artichoke-whi.Title: Creamy Artichoke & White Bean Dip Is a High-Protein Appetizer You’ll Love
https://www.eatingwell.com/artichoke-whi.Description: This creamy Artichoke & White Bean Dip brings all the cheesy comfort of a classic baked appetizer, with a plant protein–packed twist!
Ingredients: 1 (10-ounce) jar artichoke hearts in water, rinsed (about 2 cups)
2 (15-ounce) cans no-salt-added cannellini beans, rinsed (about 4 cups)
4 ounces reduced-fat cream cheese, at room temperature
2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh thyme, plus leaves for garnish
¾ cup shredded Gruyère cheese, divided
Multicolored carrots, Belgian endive leaves, Persian cucumbers and/or pita chips, for serving (optional)
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F with rack in middle position. Combine rinsed artichoke hearts and 3 garlic cloves in a food processor; process until finely chopped, about 1 minute, scraping down the sides as needed. Transfer to a 12-inch cast-iron or stainless-steel skillet.

Combine rinsed cannellini beans, 1 cup yogurt, 4 ounces cream cheese, ¼ cup Parmesan, 2 teaspoons thyme, 2 teaspoons onion powder and ½ teaspoon pepper in the food processor. Process until smooth, about 2 minutes, scraping down the sides as needed. Add to the skillet with the artichoke mixture; stir to combine. Fold in ¼ cup Gruyère and spread evenly. Top with the remaining ½ cup Gruyère.
Bake until the cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Increase oven temperature to broil; broil until the cheese is golden brown, about 7 minutes.
Garnish with thyme leaves, if desired. Serve with carrots, endive, cucumbers and/or pita chips, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/pecan-pie-but.Title: Pecan Pie Butter
https://www.eatingwell.com/pecan-pie-but.Description: This Pecan Pie Butter captures all the flavors of the classic dessert in a rich, spreadable form. It’s perfect slathered on warm biscuits, pancakes or toast.
Instructions: Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a medium nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add ½ cup pecan halves; cook, stirring often, until toasted, 1 to 2 minutes. Add 2½ tablespoons brown sugar, ¼ teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon cinnamon and ⅛ teaspoon nutmeg; cook, stirring constantly, until the sugar melts, darkens slightly and begins to coat the pecans, 1 to 2 minutes. Spread the mixture on a parchment-lined plate or baking sheet and let cool completely, about 15 minutes.

Transfer the cooled pecan mixture to a mini food processor. Pulse until finely ground and starting to become creamy, about 1 minute, stopping to scrape down the sides as needed. Add the remaining 7 tablespoons softened butter, 1 teaspoon vanilla and the remaining ¼ teaspoon salt; process until blended and spreadable, about 30 seconds.
Transfer to a jar or airtight container. Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled. Recipe developed by Marianne Williams

https://www.eatingwell.com/lemon-champag.Title: Lemon-Champagne Vinaigrette
https://www.eatingwell.com/lemon-champag.Description: Bright, zesty and endlessly versatile, this quick lemon-champagne vinaigrette brings fresh flavor to anything it touches.
Instructions: Combine ¼ cup oil, 2 tablespoons vinegar, 1 teaspoon lemon zest, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 tablespoon chopped shallot, ¼ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper in a 6-ounce jar or other container. Secure the lid and shake vigorously until well combined, about 20 seconds.

https://www.eatingwell.com/white-bean-sk.Title: This White Bean Skillet Is the 30-Minute, High-Protein Dinner You Need
https://www.eatingwell.com/white-bean-sk.Description: This easy white bean skillet brings together beans, canned tomatoes and fresh greens for a comforting plant-based dinner.
Ingredients: 1 medium yellow onion, finely chopped (about 1½ cups)
3 medium cloves garlic, finely chopped (1 tablespoon)
½ teaspoon salt plus ⅛ teaspoon, divided
¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper, plus more for garnish
1 (28-ounce) can no-salt-added whole peeled tomatoes, undrained and crushed
1 ounce Parmesan cheese, shaved and crumbled (about ⅓ cup)
8 slices whole-wheat baguette (½ ounce each), toasted
Instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add 3 tablespoons tomato paste; cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant and deepened in color, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in chopped garlic, 1½ teaspoons Italian seasoning, ½ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper; cook, stirring often, until fragrant, about 30 seconds.

Add crushed tomatoes and rinsed beans; bring to a lively simmer over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly thickened, about 3 minutes. Fold in 5 ounces spinach; cook, stirring constantly, until bright green and just wilted, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Sprinkle with the remaining ⅛ teaspoon salt.
Divide the mixture among 4 bowls. Sprinkle with crumbled Parmesan. Garnish with additional crushed red pepper, if desired. Serve with toasted baguette slices.

https://www.eatingwell.com/raspberry-man.Title: This Creamy Raspberry-Mango Chia Seed Smoothie Is Packed with 11 Grams of Fiber
https://www.eatingwell.com/raspberry-man.Description: This creamy smoothie delivers sweet tropical flavors, with frozen mango blending with raspberries and coconut milk for a thick, frosty base.
Ingredients: ½ cup whole-milk plain strained (Greek-style) yogurt
⅓ cup chopped pitted dried dates (about 2 ounces)
Instructions: Combine 1½ cups mango, 1½ cups coconut milk, ½ cup raspberries, ½ cup yogurt, ⅓ cup dates, 1½ tablespoons chia seeds and 1 tablespoon vanilla in a blender; process until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes.
Divide between 2 (16-ounce) glasses.

https://www.eatingwell.com/baked-lemon-p.Title: Baked Lemon-Pepper Salmon
https://www.eatingwell.com/baked-lemon-p.Description: This baked lemon-pepper salmon is a bright, no-fuss recipe that’s perfect for a quick weeknight dinner. Pair this salmon with roasted vegetables for dinner.
Ingredients: 8 lemon slices (⅛-inch thick; from 1 large lemon)
Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.

Pat 4 salmon fillets dry; sprinkle both sides with 1 tablespoon lemon-pepper, ½ teaspoon garlic powder and ¼ teaspoon salt. Arrange 8 lemon slices in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet; place the salmon fillets on top. Drizzle the salmon with 1 tablespoon oil.
Bake until the salmon flakes easily with a fork, about 14 minutes. Sprinkle with 2 teaspoons dill. Recipe developed by Jasmine Smith

https://www.eatingwell.com/marry-me-whit.Title: Marry Me White Bean & Spinach Skillet
https://www.eatingwell.com/marry-me-whit.Description: This Marry Me White Bean & Spinach Skillet is a different take on Marry Me Chicken — a dish traditionally made with chicken coated in a sun-dried tomato cream sauce.
Ingredients: ½ cup drained oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, chopped
½ cup grated Parmesan cheese, divided
1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil or small basil leaves
Instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add ½ cup shallots and ½ cup sun-dried tomatoes; cook, stirring often, until the shallots are softened, about 3 minutes. Add minced garlic and ½ teaspoon salt; stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add ½ cup wine and increase heat to medium-high; cook, stirring often, until the wine is almost fully reduced, about 2 minutes. Add 2 (5-ounce) packages baby spinach; cook, stirring, until starting to wilt, about 2 minutes. Add rinsed beans and ½ cup broth; cook, stirring gently, until heated through and the spinach is wilted, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in ½ cup cream and ⅓ cup Parmesan. Sprinkle evenly with the remaining 2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons Parmesan. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon basil. Serve with crusty bread, if desired. Recipe developed by Marianne Williams

https://www.eatingwell.com/curried-butte.Title: Curried Butter Beans
https://www.eatingwell.com/curried-butte.Description: Tender butter beans combine with red curry paste and aromatic spices in this hearty, plant-based dish. We use butter beans here, but any white bean like cannellini or navy would work.
Ingredients: ¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper, plus more garnish
4 cups roughly chopped stemmed lacinato kale
½ cup well-shaken and stirred canned coconut milk
2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish
Instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat until shimmering. Add chopped onion; cook, stirring often, until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in minced garlic, 2 tablespoons red curry paste, 1 tablespoon ginger, 1 teaspoon each coriander and cumin and ¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper; cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant and slightly darkened, about 1 minute.

Stir in rinsed butter beans, 1 can tomatoes, 1 cup broth and ¼ teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat; reduce heat to maintain a simmer and cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the beans are warmed through and the mixture is slightly reduced, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in 4 cups kale and ½ cup coconut milk; cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce starts to bubble around the edges and the kale is wilted and tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in 2 tablespoons cilantro. Garnish with additional crushed red pepper and cilantro and serve with lime wedges, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/chickpea-grai.Title: Chickpea Grain Bowl with Feta & Tomatoes
https://www.eatingwell.com/chickpea-grai.Description: This chickpea-farro grain bowl is a hearty dish that’s packed with plant-based protein, fiber and tons of fresh flavor.
Instructions: Whisk 2 tablespoons oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 tablespoon vinegar, 1 teaspoon oregano, ¼ teaspoon pepper and ⅛ teaspoon salt together in a small bowl.
Place ¾ cup cooked farro in each of 4 bowls. Top each with ¼ cup chickpeas, ¼ cup tomatoes, ¼ cup cucumber, ¼ avocado, ¼ cup feta and 1 tablespoon dressing.

https://www.eatingwell.com/lemony-orzo-t.Title: Lemony Orzo & Tuna Salad with Broccoli
https://www.eatingwell.com/lemony-orzo-t.Description: This pasta- and tuna-salad mashup gets a boost of color and texture from broccoli. Plenty of Kalamata olives add a briny bite.
Ingredients: 2 (5-ounce) cans tuna in olive oil, drained and flaked
Instructions: Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add 2 cups orzo; cook, stirring occasionally, until just al dente, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water until cool.
Meanwhile, whisk lemon zest, lemon juice, ¼ cup oil, ½ teaspoon pepper and ¼ teaspoon salt in a large bowl.
Add the orzo, 4 cups broccoli, the flaked tuna, 1 cup olives and 1 tablespoon oregano to the dressing; stir to combine.

https://www.eatingwell.com/turmeric-chic.Title: Turmeric Chicken & Avocado Wraps
https://www.eatingwell.com/turmeric-chic.Description: These chicken salad wraps are packed with ingredients that help reduce inflammation.
Ingredients: ⅓ cup whole-milk plain strained (Greek-style) yogurt
2 cups spring mix salad greens, divided
Instructions: Whisk ½ cup mayonnaise, ⅓ cup yogurt, 2 teaspoons mustard, ¾ teaspoon each cinnamon, cumin and turmeric and ½ teaspoon salt together in a large bowl. Add 1 cup chicken, the rinsed chickpeas, the toasted walnuts, ⅓ cup raisins, 3 tablespoons shallots and 2 tablespoons cilantro; stir until evenly coated and combined.

When ready to serve, thinly slice avocado. Top 1 tortilla with ½ cup spring mix and one-quarter of the sliced avocado. Top with about ½ cup chicken mixture. Roll the tortilla up and over the filling, like a burrito, tucking in the sides to help keep the ingredients in. Repeat with the remaining tortillas, spring mix, avocado and chicken mixture. Slice the wraps in half crosswise to serve. Recipe developed by Tricia Manzanero Stuedeman

https://www.eatingwell.com/no-cook-white.Title: No-Cook White Bean & Spinach Caprese Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/no-cook-white.Description: This easy white bean and spinach caprese salad features the classic combination of juicy tomatoes, creamy mozzarella, fragrant basil, and tangy balsamic vinegar, but adds tender white beans and fresh baby spinach to the mix.
Ingredients: 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil, plus more for garnish
Instructions: Whisk vinegar, oil, mustard, salt and pepper together in a large bowl. Add spinach, beans, tomatoes, mozzarella and basil; toss to combine. Garnish with more fresh basil, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/257722.Title: Roasted Vegetable & Black Bean Tacos
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/257722.Description: These hearty vegan tacos are quick and easy to make, perfect for busy weeknights. They are so tasty no one will miss the meat or dairy.
Ingredients: 1 cup roasted root vegetables (see associated recipe)
0.5 cup cooked or canned black beans, rinsed
4 corn tortillas, lightly toasted or warmed
Chopped fresh cilantro & salsa for garnish
Instructions: Combine roasted root vegetables, beans, oil, cumin, chili powder, coriander, salt and pepper in a saucepan. Cover and cook over medium-low heat until heated through, 6 to 8 minutes.
Divide the mixture among the tortillas. Top with avocado. Serve with lime wedges. Garnish with cilantro and/or salsa, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/chopped-salad.Title: Chopped Salad with Italian Vinaigrette
https://www.eatingwell.com/chopped-salad.Description: This salad is a crisp, colorful mix of veggies. It’s tossed with a zesty homemade vinaigrette while chickpeas bring on the plant-based protein.
Instructions: Whisk 3 tablespoons oil, 2 tablespoons vinegar, 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning, ½ teaspoon each onion powder, garlic powder and salt and ¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper together in a large bowl. Add 2½ cups kale; massage with the dressing until the kale is dark and shiny. Add 1½ cups cabbage, the rinsed chickpeas, quartered tomatoes, diced bell pepper, diced cucumber, ½ cup parsley and the sliced scallions; toss to coat.

https://www.eatingwell.com/bhel-puri-ins.Title: This High-Fiber Salad Is Inspired By Indian Street Food and Helps Me Manage My Blood Sugar
https://www.eatingwell.com/bhel-puri-ins.Description: This flavorful salad was inspired by bhel puri, a type of chaat (savory snack) served across India, and features puffed quinoa and lentils for extra protein and fiber.
Ingredients: 1 small green or red bell pepper, finely diced
1 large English hothouse cucumber or 3 Persian cucumbers, finely diced
1 jalapeno, seeded to taste and finely diced
2/3 cup sweet corn kernels (roasted or cooked if fresh and thawed if frozen)
1/2 cup finely chopped Roma or cherry tomatoes
Instructions: Evenly divide lentils, bell pepper, cucumber, jalapeño (if using), corn and quinoa between two bowls. Drizzle with tamarind-date chutney and coriander chutney. Top with tomatoes, onion, cilantro and peanuts.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/264141.Title: Baked Eggs in Tomato Sauce with Kale
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/264141.Description: You can make these three-ingredient tomato-simmered eggs with things you probably already have on hand in your fridge and pantry. To make these baked eggs more like eggs in purgatory, look for a spicy tomato sauce and don't forget some whole-wheat bread for dipping.
Ingredients: 3 10-ounce packages frozen chopped kale, thawed, drained and squeezed dry (9 cups)
1 25-ounce jar low-sodium marinara sauce or 3 cups canned low-sodium tomato sauce
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.

Heat oil in a 10-inch cast-iron skillet or nonstick ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add kale, season with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper, and sauté for 2 minutes. Stir in marinara (or tomato) sauce and bring to a simmer.
Make 8 wells in the sauce with the back of a spoon and carefully crack an egg into each well. Season the eggs with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
Transfer the pan to the oven and bake until the egg whites are set and the yolks are still soft, about 20 minutes.

https://www.eatingwell.com/herb-marinate.Title: Herb-Marinated Veggie & Chickpea Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/herb-marinate.Description: This herb-marinated veggie & chickpea salad is a refreshing, no-cook dish packed with fresh flavors.
Ingredients: 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, plus more for garnish
1 medium red bell pepper, stems and seeds removed, roughly chopped
1 (14.5 ounce) can no-salt added chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1/2 head romaine lettuce, roughly chopped (about 5 cups)
Instructions: Whisk 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 teaspoon mustard, ¼ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper together in a large bowl until smooth. Add ¼ cup parsley and 2 teaspoons thyme; whisk to combine. Slowly drizzle in ¼ cup oil while continuing to whisk until well combined. Add chopped tomato, chopped bell pepper, ¼ cup onion and the rinsed chickpeas; toss well. Let marinate at room temperature for at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour.
When ready to serve, add 5 cups lettuce and 2 cups cabbage to the bowl; toss well to combine. Divide the salad among 4 bowls; top with ⅓ cup Parmesan. Garnish with additional parsley, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/270572.Title: Chopped Chicken & Sweet Potato Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/270572.Description: This easy salad recipe allows for a wonderful use of leftover cooked chicken. Look for escarole in the produce section near the leafy greens; if you can't find it, you can use romaine instead.
Ingredients: 3 cups coarsely chopped escarole or romaine lettuce
Instructions: Toss 3 cups chopped escarole (or romaine), ½ cup sweet potato, 3 ounces shredded chicken, and ¼ cup sliced apple with vinaigrette; place on a 9-inch plate.
Top with ¼ cup chopped avocado, 2 tablespoons sunflower seeds, and ½ ounce cubed Cheddar.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/791237.Title: Salmon with Lemon-Herb Orzo & Broccoli
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/791237.Description: This healthy salmon orzo is delicious and well-balanced. Add broccoli to the pasta while it's cooking to save time, and there's one less pot to wash!
Ingredients: 1.25 pounds skin-on salmon fillet, cut into 4 portions, patted dry
4 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs, such as tarragon, chives and/or parsley
Instructions: Bring 2 quarts water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add 1 cup orzo and cook according to package directions, adding 2 cups broccoli for the last minute of cooking. Drain and rinse with cold water.

Meanwhile, heat 1 1/2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle the 1 1/4 pounds of salmon with 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Add to the pan, skin-side up and cook until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Flip and cook until the flesh is opaque, 3 to 5 minutes, depending on thickness.
Whisk 2 tablespoons oil, herbs, 2 teaspoons lemon zest, 1 tablespoon lemon juice and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Add the orzo and broccoli; stir until combined.
Serve the orzo mixture with the salmon and drizzle with the remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons oil.

https://www.eatingwell.com/broccoli-ched.Title: Broccoli-Cheddar Butter Beans
https://www.eatingwell.com/broccoli-ched.Description: These broccoli-Cheddar butter beans are a cozy dish that will remind you of broccoli-Cheddar soup, but in a convenient skillet.
Ingredients: ½ cup finely chopped yellow onion
3 medium cloves garlic, finely chopped (about 1 tablespoon)
12 ounces fresh broccoli florets, cut into ½-inch pieces (about 4 cups)
1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, divided
Instructions: Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add ½ cup onion and the chopped garlic; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 2 minutes. Add cut broccoli, stirring until well combined. Pour in ⅓ cup broth; cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until the broccoli is tender-crisp and bright green, 3 to 4 minutes.

Stir in rinsed beans, ¾ cup half-and-half and ½ teaspoon each pepper, dry mustard and salt. Bring to a lively simmer over medium-high heat. Simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the beans are warmed through and the sauce has thickened slightly, about 2 minutes. Let cool for 2 minutes, then stir in ¾ cup Cheddar until melted. Sprinkle with the remaining ¼ cup Cheddar. Serve with toasted baguette slices.

https://www.eatingwell.com/sheet-pan-sal.Title: Sheet-Pan Salmon & Shaved Brussels Sprouts
https://www.eatingwell.com/sheet-pan-sal.Description: This sheet-pan salmon and Brussels sprouts recipe is a game-changer for weeknight dinners.
Ingredients: 1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves or ½ teaspoon dried thyme
1 pound Brussels sprouts, trimmed and thinly shaved (about 6 cups)
½ teaspoon salt plus ⅛ teaspoon, divided
Instructions: Preheat broiler with rack in middle position. Line a large rimmed baking sheet with foil. Zest 2 lemons to yield 2 teaspoons zest and juice the lemons to yield ¼ cup juice. Mince 4 garlic cloves to yield 1½ tablespoons and smash the remaining 2 garlic cloves.

Combine 2 teaspoons oregano, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 teaspoon fresh thyme (or ½ teaspoon dried), 1 teaspoon black pepper, ¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper (if using), the lemon zest, 3 tablespoons lemon juice and the minced garlic in a small bowl. Add 1 tablespoon oil; whisk to combine.

Combine sliced Brussels sprouts, sliced shallot and the smashed garlic with 1 tablespoon oil on the prepared baking sheet; spread in an even layer. Nestle 4 salmon fillets, skin-side down, among the vegetables. Drizzle the salmon and vegetables with the lemon mixture.
Broil until the Brussels sprouts are tender and the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with ½ teaspoon salt.

Place the roasted garlic cloves on a cutting board and mash into a paste using the flat side of a large knife; transfer to a small bowl. Whisk in the remaining 2 tablespoons oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice and ⅛ teaspoon salt. Drizzle the lemon mixture evenly over the salmon and Brussels sprouts; toss the Brussels sprouts.

https://www.eatingwell.com/blueberry-ban.Title: Blueberry-Banana Peanut Butter Parfait
https://www.eatingwell.com/blueberry-ban.Description: This blueberry-banana peanut butter parfait is a delicious layered breakfast that combines fruit, yogurt and nutty goodness.
Ingredients: ¼ cup whole-milk vanilla strained (Greek-style) yogurt
Instructions: Slice banana; place half the slices (about ½ cup) in a medium (12-ounce) jar. Sprinkle with ⅛ teaspoon cinnamon; mash with the back of a fork until no large chunks remain. Top with 2 tablespoons blueberries. Add 1 tablespoon peanut butter and spread into an even layer; top with ¼ cup yogurt. Drizzle the yogurt layer evenly with ½ teaspoon honey. Top with the remaining banana slices and 2 tablespoons blueberries. Recipe developed by Marianne Williams

https://www.eatingwell.com/high-protein-.Title: High-Protein Caesar Dip
https://www.eatingwell.com/high-protein-.Description: This high-protein dip—reminiscent of Caesar salad dressing—is the perfect companion for your favorite veggies.
Ingredients: ¼ cup lemon juice (from 2 small lemons)
¾ teaspoon ground pepper, plus more for garnish
Lettuce spears, cucumbers, carrots, radishes and/or whole-wheat crackers, for dipping (optional)
Instructions: Whisk 2 cups yogurt, ½ cup sour cream, ¼ cup lemon juice, ¼ cup water, 2 tablespoons Parmesan, 1 tablespoon garlic powder, 2½ teaspoons Worcestershire, 2 teaspoons mustard, ¾ teaspoon pepper and ¾ teaspoon salt together in a medium bowl until smooth and well combined. Garnish with additional pepper, if desired. Serve with desired dippers.

https://www.eatingwell.com/mediterranean.Title: The #1 Mediterranean Diet Snack You Should Be Making
https://www.eatingwell.com/mediterranean.Description: With a focus on fiber-rich beans, vegetables and healthy fats, this creamy cannellini dip is suitable for those following the Mediterranean diet.
Ingredients: 2 (15-ounce) cans no-salt-added cannellini beans, rinsed (about 4 cups)
¾ cup finely grated Parmesan cheese, divided
¼ cup lemon juice (from 2 small lemons)
2 medium cloves garlic, grated (about ½ teaspoon)
¾ cup julienne-cut sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained and chopped, plus 1 tablespoon oil from jar, divided
1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
2 cups multicolored small baby carrots, trimmed and peeled
2 cups mini bell peppers, halved lengthwise
2 cups small French radishes with tops, cleaned
Instructions: Combine rinsed beans, ½ cup plus 3 tablespoons Parmesan, ⅓ cup oil, ¼ cup lemon juice, ¼ cup sour cream, grated garlic, 1 teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon pepper and ½ teaspoon Italian seasoning in a food processor; process until smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes.
Transfer to a serving bowl and fold in ½ cup sun-dried tomatoes until well combined.
Sprinkle with the remaining ¼ cup sun-dried tomatoes. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon sun-dried tomato oil. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon basil, 1 tablespoon parsley and the remaining 1 tablespoon Parmesan.
Serve with 2 cups carrots, 2 cups mini peppers, 2 cups radishes and 2 cups sugar snap peas.

https://www.eatingwell.com/chocolate-str.Title: Chocolate-Strawberry Protein Shake
https://www.eatingwell.com/chocolate-str.Description: Soy milk and Greek-style yogurt provide a solid protein base for this chocolate-strawberry protein shake.
Ingredients: ½ cup low-fat plain strained (Greek-style) yogurt
Instructions: Place ¾ cup soy milk, ⅓ cup banana, 1 cup strawberries, ½ cup yogurt, ½ tablespoon cocoa powder and 2 ice cubes in a blender; process until smooth.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/805481.Title: Ricotta-Tomato Toast
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/805481.Description: This tomato toast features a creamy ricotta cheese spread and, of course, juicy ripe summer tomatoes.
Ingredients: 0.5 cup coarsely chopped fresh basil, plus more for garnish
0.25 cup chopped fresh chives, plus more for garnish
2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil plus 1 1/2 teaspoons, divided
2 small multicolored heirloom tomatoes, sliced 1/4-inch thick
Instructions: Combine ricotta, basil, chives, 2 tablespoons oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a food processor; process until smooth, about 1 minute.

Spread the mixture evenly over toast slices. Top with tomatoes; drizzle with the remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons oil. Garnish with additional basil and chives before serving, if desired. Additional reporting by Carrie Myers and Jan Valdez

https://www.eatingwell.com/everything-ba.Title: Everything Bagel Cottage Cheese Snack Jar with Bell Peppers & Chickpeas
https://www.eatingwell.com/everything-ba.Description: This Everything Bagel cottage cheese snack jar is a high-protein snack that layers creamy cottage cheese with crunchy bell peppers and crispy chickpeas.
Ingredients: ½ cup no-salt-added fat-free cottage cheese
1 tablespoon no-salt-added everything bagel seasoning, plus more for garnish
1 small red bell pepper, chopped (about ½ cup)
Instructions: Stir ½ cup cottage cheese, 1 tablespoon everything seasoning and a pinch of salt together in a 16-ounce jar. Top with chopped bell pepper and ⅓ cup chickpeas. Garnish with additional everything seasoning, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/peanut-butter.Title: Peanut Butter Yogurt Cup with Magic Shell Topping
https://www.eatingwell.com/peanut-butter.Description: This easy, high-protein snack tastes just like a Reese’s peanut butter cup. You can conveniently make it in the yogurt container for quick cleanup.
Instructions: Mix yogurt and peanut butter together in the yogurt container or a small bowl.

Combine chocolate chips and coconut oil in a small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on High in 15-second intervals, stirring after each, until the chocolate is melted and smooth (about 45 to 60 seconds total). Pour over the yogurt mixture and spread evenly to cover. Garnish with peanuts and/or salt, if desired. Freeze for 10 minutes or refrigerate for 30 minutes, until the chocolate is set.

https://www.eatingwell.com/cottage-chees.Title: Cottage Cheese Snack Jar with Fruit
https://www.eatingwell.com/cottage-chees.Description: Create a creamy and on-the-go snack by combining protein-packed cottage cheese with sweet chopped peaches.
Ingredients: 1/2 cup diced peaches, fresh or thawed if frozen
Instructions: Place cottage cheese in a jar. Top with peaches and pecans. Cover and refrigerate for up to 1 day.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/807543.Title: Pumpkin Spice Energy Balls
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/807543.Description: These pumpkin pie spice energy balls are everything you could want in a snack: classic pumpkin spice flavor with a satisfyingly chewy texture with bits of crunch from seeds and nuts throughout.
Ingredients: 0.5 cup smooth natural cashew butter or creamy natural almond butter
1 cup pitted dried Medjool dates, chopped (see Note)
Instructions: Stir together cashew butter (or almond butter), pumpkin and vanilla in a small bowl.

Process dates and pecans in a food processor until finely chopped, about 1 minute. Add oats, pepitas, chia seeds, pumpkin pie spice and salt. Process until fully combined, about 10 (1-second) pulses. Add the pumpkin mixture; process until fully combined and incorporated, about 10 (1-second) pulses, stopping to scrape down sides as needed.

Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Using a 1-tablespoon cookie scoop or measuring spoon, scoop 24 portions of the oat mixture onto the prepared baking sheet. Using clean hands, roll each portion into a ball. Serve immediately or refrigerate, covered, for up to 5 days.

https://www.eatingwell.com/cottage-chees.Title: The Last Cottage Cheese Toast Recipe You’ll Ever Need
https://www.eatingwell.com/cottage-chees.Description: Had your fill of toast that barely takes the edge off your hunger? Say hello to our new-and-improved cottage cheese toast!
Ingredients: 1 slice whole wheat country bread (½-inch thick), toasted
Instructions: Spread cottage cheese over toast.

https://www.eatingwell.com/blt-breakfast.Title: BLT Breakfast Sandwich
https://www.eatingwell.com/blt-breakfast.Description: This open-face sandwich is a delicious way to start your day. Turkey bacon provides savory flavor and crunch while keeping fat and calories in check.
Ingredients: 1 slice cooked turkey bacon, cut in half
Instructions: Combine 2 teaspoons mayonnaise and the chopped sun-dried tomato in a small bowl. Spread on 1 side of toast slice;  top with 3 lettuce leaves, 2 tomato slices and the bacon pieces. Sprinkle with ⅛ teaspoon pepper.

https://www.eatingwell.com/chia-smoothie.Title: Strawberry-Peach Chia Seed Smoothie
https://www.eatingwell.com/chia-smoothie.Description: This fiber-rich chia smoothie is sweet and tangy, with a velvety texture thanks to nutritious chia seeds that expand as they combine with liquid.
Instructions: Place 1⅓ cups almond milk, 1 cup strawberries, 1 cup peaches, ½ cup yogurt, ¼ cup cherries, 3 dates and 2 tablespoons chia seeds in a blender. Process until smooth, about 1 minute, scraping down the sides of the blender as necessary. Divide between 2 glasses and serve immediately.

https://www.eatingwell.com/banana-peanut.Title: Banana–Peanut Butter Yogurt Parfait
https://www.eatingwell.com/banana-peanut.Description: This banana–peanut butter yogurt parfait is a delicious and nutritious breakfast or snack that relies on the natural sweetness of ripe bananas to create a creamy, flavorful base.
Ingredients: ¼ cup low-fat plain Greek-style strained yogurt
Instructions: Slice 1 banana; place half the slices in a small bowl or jar. Sprinkle with ⅛ teaspoon cinnamon; mash with the back of a fork. Top with 1 tablespoon peanut butter; layer on ¼ cup yogurt. Top with the remaining banana slices and 1 tablespoon peanuts.

https://www.eatingwell.com/chopped-lox-v.Title: Chopped Lox & Veggie Bagel
https://www.eatingwell.com/chopped-lox-v.Description: Chopping the veggies and smoked salmon together with the cream cheese allows for an even distribution of ingredients, ensuring the perfect bite every time. We like the flavor and fiber that a whole-grain everything bagel adds, but any kind of bagel works well here.
Instructions: Spread cream cheese on a cutting board. Top with smoked salmon, tomato, cucumber, onion, scallion, dill and capers; season with pepper. Chop the mixture until it’s chunky and everything is well incorporated. Divide the mixture evenly between 2 bagel halves; top with the other halves.

https://www.eatingwell.com/berry-green-t.Title: Berry–Green Tea Smoothie
https://www.eatingwell.com/berry-green-t.Description: This berry-green tea smoothie recipe is a refreshing, nutrient-packed beverage with plenty of anti-inflammatory benefits.
Ingredients: 1 cup chilled unsweetened, strong brewed green tea
¼ cup whole-milk plain strained (Greek-style) yogurt
Instructions: Combine 2 cups frozen berries, 1 cup tea, ¼ cup yogurt, 3 dates and 1½ tablespoons chia seeds in a blender; process until smooth, about 1 minute. Pour into a glass and serve immediately.

https://www.eatingwell.com/shredded-whea.Title: Shredded Wheat with Raisins & Walnuts
https://www.eatingwell.com/shredded-whea.Description: This shredded wheat with raisins & walnuts is an easy breakfast to reach for when you want something quick with plenty of fiber and healthy fats.
Ingredients: ½ cup raisins or other unsweetened dried fruit
2 cups reduced-fat milk or other milk of choice, divided
Instructions: Combine 4 cups shredded wheat, 1½ cups walnuts and ½ cup raisins in a large bowl; toss gently to combine. Transfer to a large jar or other resealable food-safe container; store at room temperature for up to 4 months.
To serve, place 1½ cups cereal mixture in a bowl; top with ½ cup milk.

https://www.eatingwell.com/egg-tomato-fe.Title: Egg, Tomato & Feta Breakfast Pita
https://www.eatingwell.com/egg-tomato-fe.Description: This za’atar pita fried egg is perfect for those looking to enjoy a delicious start to their day!
Instructions: Combine ¼ cup each cucumber and tomato, 1 tablespoon feta and ½ teaspoon za’atar in a small bowl; toss to coat.

Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Break 2 eggs, one at a time, into the skillet. Cover and cook until the whites are set, about 2 minutes. Uncover and cook until the whites are completely set and the edges are crisp, about 2 minutes 30 seconds. Sprinkle the eggs with the remaining ¼ teaspoon za’atar; place each inside a pita half. Divide the cucumber-tomato mixture between the pitas.

https://www.eatingwell.com/tomato-toasts.Title: Tomato Toast with Herbed Cream Cheese
https://www.eatingwell.com/tomato-toasts.Description: This tomato toast is ideal for showcasing sweet, fresh heirloom tomatoes at their summer peak.
Ingredients: ¼ cup cream cheese (2 ounces), at room temperature
1 tablespoon sliced fresh chives, plus more for garnish
¼ teaspoon ground pepper, plus more for garnish
2 (½-inch) slices country-style whole-wheat bread, lightly toasted
Instructions: Stir cream cheese, yogurt, chives, dill and pepper together in a small bowl until well combined.
Spread the cream cheese mixture on 1 side of each toast slice. Top with tomato slices. Sprinkle with salt and drizzle with oil. Garnish with additional chives and pepper, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/orange-mango-.Title: Dylan Dreyer’s Orange-Mango Smoothie
https://www.eatingwell.com/orange-mango-.Description: For Dylan Dreyer, Today’s 3rd Hour co-host and NBC News meteorologist, this smoothie is a staple in her household during cold and flu season. The vitamin C from the oranges helps support immune health.
Instructions: Combine 2 chopped oranges, ½ cup almond milk, ⅓ cup sliced banana and ⅓ cup mango in a blender. Puree on High until smooth, about 1 minute.

https://www.eatingwell.com/spinach-feta-.Title: Spinach & Feta Mug Scrambled Eggs
https://www.eatingwell.com/spinach-feta-.Description: Whip up eggs with a few simple ingredients in a microwave-safe mug, and you have the makings of a breakfast that’s prepped, seasoned and will be ready to eat in a little more than a minute before running out the door.
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill, plus more for garnish
Instructions: Coat 4 (12-ounce) microwave-safe mugs with cooking spray. Crack 2 eggs into each prepared mug. Add 1 tablespoon half-and-half to each; whisk with a fork until completely blended. Add 2 tablespoons spinach, 1 tablespoon feta and 1½ teaspoons dill to each mug, stirring until combined. Sprinkle with salt. Cover and refrigerate for up to 4 days.

When ready to eat, uncover a mug and microwave on High, stirring every 15 to 20 seconds, until set, 1 minute and 15 seconds to 1 minute and 25 seconds for large curds (about 1 minute for soft-scramble). Stir with a fork to create fluffy curds. Sprinkle with additional dill, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/804588.Title: Lemon-Berry Ricotta Toast
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/804588.Description: Creamy ricotta cheese keeps fresh, sweet berries in place in this quick and simple breakfast.
Ingredients: 0.5 teaspoon lemon zest plus 1/4 teaspoon, divided
0.5 cup fresh berries, such as blueberries, strawberries and/or blackberries
Instructions: Mix ricotta, maple syrup and 1/2 teaspoon lemon zest in a small bowl. Spread onto 1 side of each toast slice. Top each toast with 1/4 cup berries and sprinkle with 1/8 teaspoon lemon zest.

https://www.eatingwell.com/strawberry-ma.Title: Strawberry-Mango Chia Seed Smoothie
https://www.eatingwell.com/strawberry-ma.Description: This strawberry-mango chia seed smoothie is a nutrient-packed drink rich in fiber, antioxidants and omega-3 fatty acids.
Ingredients: 1½ cups quartered fresh strawberries, plus more for garnish
½ cup whole-milk plain strained (Greek-style) yogurt
⅓ cup pitted dried dates (2 ounces), coarsely chopped
Instructions: Combine 2 cups mango, 1½ cups strawberries, ¾ cup ice, 1 cup almond milk, ½ cup yogurt, the chopped dates and 1½ tablespoons chia seeds in a blender; process until smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides as needed, about 30 seconds. Divide between 2 large glasses. Garnish with strawberries, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/ricotta-toast.Title: Ricotta Toast with Peaches & Prosciutto
https://www.eatingwell.com/ricotta-toast.Description: This ricotta toast with peaches and prosciutto offers the perfect balance of creamy, sweet and savory flavors.
Instructions: Spread ¼ cup ricotta on each of 2 toast slices. Top each with 1 slice prosciutto and half the peach slices. Season to taste with cracked black pepper.

https://www.eatingwell.com/chocolate-che.Title: Chocolate-Cherry Protein Shake
https://www.eatingwell.com/chocolate-che.Description: This chocolate-cherry protein shake made with Greek-style yogurt and peanut butter is a protein powerhouse, perfect for a post-workout refuel or a satisfying snack.
Ingredients: ½ cup plain reduced-fat strained (Greek-style) yogurt
Instructions: Combine 1½ cups soymilk, sliced bananas, 1 cup cherries, ½ cup yogurt, 2 tablespoons peanut butter and 1 tablespoon cocoa in a blender; process until smooth and creamy, 1 to 2 minutes, increasing the speed from low to high; use a tamper to help the ingredients blend if needed. Serve immediately.

https://www.eatingwell.com/feta-egg-spin.Title: Feta, Egg & Spinach Breakfast Taco
https://www.eatingwell.com/feta-egg-spin.Description: It doesn’t get easier than this healthy breakfast taco that’s ready in just five minutes. Kale or arugula will work just as well if you don’t have spinach on hand.
Ingredients: 1 teaspoon avocado oil or canola oil
Instructions: Heat oil in a small nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook tortilla, flipping once, until softened, about 1 minute total; transfer to a plate. Add spinach to the pan; cook, stirring, until just barely wilted, about 1 minute. Transfer to the tortilla. Sprinkle feta in an egg-sized circle in the pan, leaving an open spot in the center. Break egg into the feta. Cover and cook until the egg is done to your liking, about 2 minutes for over easy. Transfer to the spinach and drizzle with hot sauce, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/255761.Title: Apple, Fig & Brussels Sprouts Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/255761.Description: Salad dressing made from sweet and mellow white balsamic vinegar balances out the assertive greens and Brussels sprouts in this healthy winter salad. If you have one handy, a small mandoline makes it easy to slice the Brussels and apple. To make it a dinner salad, top with shrimp or chicken.
Ingredients: 1 cup very thinly sliced Brussels sprouts
4 fresh figs, halved or quartered if large
Instructions: Whisk vinegar, mustard, shallot, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Whisk in oil until well combined.

Combine kale (and/or frisée), endive, Brussels sprouts, apple and walnuts in a large bowl. Drizzle with the dressing and toss to coat. Add a generous grinding of pepper. Top with figs, pomegranate seeds and dried cranberries.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/252084.Title: Winter Salad with Toasted Walnuts
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/252084.Description: This salad was one of the favorites chosen from over 1,000 salad recipes for our 30th anniversary issue. In 2004, Deborah Madison waxed poetic about winter ingredients, particularly nuts. “In the chill air of winter, nuts move up to center stage as do their warming, substantial, golden oils--so good with winter salad greens and vegetables, such as shaved fennel, all of which are likely to end up in a salad together,” she says. Madison suggested using a mix of lettuces that balance each other here--a mild, tender variety, such as Boston, with a more intense and sturdy green, such as escarole, for instance.
Ingredients: 4 cups mixed salad greens, such as fris&#233;e, watercress, Boston, escarole and/or curly endive, torn into bite-size pieces
1 Belgian endive, cut crosswise into thin slices
1 small fennel bulb, trimmed and cut into 2-inch slivers
Instructions: To prepare vinaigrette: Combine shallot, vinegar, mustard and salt in a small bowl. Let stand for 5 minutes, then whisk in oil.
To prepare salad: Combine salad greens, endive, fennel and mushrooms. Drizzle with the vinaigrette and toss to coat well. Sprinkle with walnuts and serve immediately.

https://www.eatingwell.com/loaded-bean-s.Title: Loaded Bean Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/loaded-bean-s.Description: This loaded bean salad is a simple yet satisfying dish that's full of creamy texture and all the classic fixings.
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill, plus more for garnish
4 tablespoons shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, divided
Instructions: Cook 3 slices bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate. Reserve 1 tablespoon bacon fat; discard the remaining fat. Chop the bacon when cool enough to handle. Set aside 1 tablespoon for garnish.

Whisk ¼ cup mayonnaise, ¼ cup sour cream, 2 tablespoons dill, 1½ tablespoons vinegar, ½ teaspoon garlic powder, ¼ teaspoon salt, ¼ teaspoon pepper and the reserved bacon fat together in a medium serving bowl.
Reserve 2 tablespoons sliced scallions for garnish. Add the remaining scallions to the dressing in the bowl, along with the rinsed beans, chopped bacon and 3 tablespoons cheese. Gently toss to coat.
Top with the reserved scallions and bacon and the remaining 1 tablespoon cheese. Garnish with additional dill, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/green-bean-ca.Title: Green Bean Caesar Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/green-bean-ca.Description: This green bean Caesar salad is a crisp and flavorful twist on the classic Caesar. Blanched green beans replace the traditional romaine.
Ingredients: 1½ teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil plus 2 tablespoons, divided
3 tablespoons seasoned or plain panko breadcrumbs
⅓ cup whole-milk plain strained (Greek-style) yogurt
2½ tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese, plus 2 tablespoons shaved, divided
⅛ teaspoon ground pepper, plus more for garnish
Instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add trimmed green beans; cook until crisp-tender and bright green, about 5 minutes. Drain the beans thoroughly; pat dry with a paper towel and transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle with ⅛ teaspoon salt.
Meanwhile, heat 1½ teaspoons oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add 3 tablespoons panko; cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.

In a small bowl, whisk ⅓ cup yogurt, 2½ tablespoons grated Parmesan, 2 teaspoons lemon juice, ¾ teaspoon Worcestershire, ½ teaspoon anchovy paste (if using), ½ teaspoon mustard, the grated garlic, ⅛ teaspoon pepper, and the remaining 2 tablespoons oil until combined. If needed, whisk in water, 1 teaspoon at a time, until desired consistency is reached.
Drizzle the dressing over the beans. Top with the toasted panko and the remaining 2 tablespoons shaved Parmesan. Garnish with pepper, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/cabbage-crunc.Title: Cabbage Crunch Salad with Cider Vinaigrette
https://www.eatingwell.com/cabbage-crunc.Description: This crisp and fresh cabbage-apple salad is combined with carrots, walnuts and creamy Gorgonzola cheese.
Ingredients: 4 cups chopped cabbage (such as napa, red or green)
1 cup thinly sliced unpeeled Honeycrisp apples
Instructions: Whisk 3 tablespoons each chives and oil, 2½ tablespoons vinegar, 2 teaspoons honey, 1 teaspoon mustard, ¼ teaspoon pepper and ⅛ teaspoon salt together in a large bowl until well combined. Add cabbage, carrots, apples, ⅓ cup walnuts and ⅓ cup Gorgonzola; toss until well coated. Let stand, uncovered, tossing occasionally, until the cabbage is slightly softened, about 10 minutes for napa cabbage and 20 minutes for red and green cabbage.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/281571.Title: Kale Salad with Balsamic & Parmesan
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/281571.Description: In this healthy kale salad recipe, you massage the dressing into the kale, tenderizing the leaves and infusing the salad with sweet balsamic flavor. Creamy pine nuts and salty Parmesan cheese added at the end balance the flavors. Enjoy this salad on its own as a side dish or add cooked chicken, shrimp or steak to make it a full meal.
Instructions: Whisk oil, vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper in a large bowl; add kale. With clean hands, firmly massage the kale to work in the dressing. Stop when the greens are softened and reduced in volume. Stir in Parmesan and pine nuts.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/795170.Title: Caesar Salad with Crispy Artichokes
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/795170.Description: In this healthy Caesar salad, we skip croutons in favor of cheesy pan-fried artichokes for an extra boost of vegetables.
Ingredients: 6 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese, divided, plus more for garnish
1 (14 ounce) can whole artichoke hearts, rinsed and halved
2 large romaine hearts (1 pound total), chopped
Instructions: Place flour in a shallow dish. Lightly beat egg in another shallow dish. Combine panko and 4 tablespoons Parmesan in a third shallow dish. Pat artichokes dry. Toss artichokes in the flour to coat. Dip in the egg, letting excess drip off. Then roll in the panko mixture.

Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the artichoke hearts and cook, flipping once, until crispy and golden on both sides, 1 to 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate.

Whisk mayonnaise, lemon juice, mustard, garlic, anchovy paste, if using, and the remaining 2 tablespoons each oil and Parmesan in a large bowl until combined. Toss romaine with the dressing until coated. Serve with the crispy artichoke hearts and garnish with pepper and more Parmesan, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/803799.Title: Kale & Shaved Brussels Sprouts Salad with Avocado Caesar Dressing
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/803799.Description: This salad combines the flavors of a Caesar salad with tender green lacinato kale and the crunch of raw, shaved Brussels sprouts.
Ingredients: 2 bunches lacinato kale (about 8 ounces each), stemmed and chopped
12 ounces fresh Brussels sprouts, trimmed and thinly sliced
Instructions: Melt butter in a medium nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook, swirling the pan occasionally, until the butter turns golden brown and smells nutty, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in panko; cook, stirring constantly, until coated in butter and toasted, 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined bowl.

Process avocado, lemon juice, Parmesan, miso, garlic, mustard, pepper and salt in a mini food processor until combined, about 30 seconds. Add oil; process until thickened and smooth, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Transfer to a large bowl.

Add kale to the bowl with the dressing. Using clean hands, massage the dressing into the kale to soften it, 1 to 2 minutes. Add sliced Brussels sprouts and toss to combine. Top with the toasted breadcrumbs.

https://www.eatingwell.com/cacio-e-pepe-.Title: The #1 Anti-Inflammatory Salad You Should Be Making
https://www.eatingwell.com/cacio-e-pepe-.Description: This easy kale salad draws flavor inspiration from the classic Italian pasta dish cacio e pepe, which translates to cheese and pepper. The signature flavors of sharp Pecorino Romano cheese and freshly ground black pepper transform kale into a delicious, anti-inflammatory side salad.
Ingredients: 1 pound lacinato kale, stemmed and thinly sliced (about 8 cups packed)
¾ cup grated Pecorino Romano cheese
Instructions: Whisk 2 tablespoons oil, 1 tablespoon vinegar and 1 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl. Add sliced kale; working with clean hands, firmly massage and crush the kale until the volume is reduced by about half and the kale has darkened slightly in color, 1 to 2 minutes. Sprinkle with ¾ cup Pecorino Romano; toss to coat. Drizzle with the remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Recipe developed by Marianne Williams

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/252867.Title: Warm Pear & Spinach Salad with Maple-Bacon Vinaigrette
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/252867.Description: Mature, larger-leaved spinach holds up better to the warm bacon vinaigrette than baby spinach in this healthy spinach salad recipe. If you don't want the spinach to wilt, let the dressing cool before tossing it with the salad.
Ingredients: 10 cups fresh spinach, tough stems removed
1 medium firm ripe pear, thinly sliced
Instructions: Combine spinach, pear and onion in a large bowl.

Cook bacon in a small skillet over medium heat until crisp, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to a plate with a slotted spoon. Add enough oil to the pan drippings to make 2 tablespoons total. Add vinegar, syrup, salt and pepper; bring to a simmer. Immediately pour the dressing over the salad and gently toss to coat. Serve sprinkled with the bacon and walnuts.

https://www.eatingwell.com/honey-mustard.Title: Honey-Mustard Bean Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/honey-mustard.Description: This honey-mustard bean salad is the perfect combination of sweet, tangy and downright delicious flavors.
Ingredients: 1 small red bell pepper, minced (about 1 cup)
Instructions: Whisk 2 tablespoons vinegar, 2 tablespoons mustard, 1 tablespoon honey, ½ teaspoon garlic and ½ teaspoon salt together in a large bowl; gradually add 2 tablespoons oil, whisking constantly.
Add rinsed cannellini beans, rinsed chickpeas, minced bell pepper and ¼ cup shallots to the honey-mustard mixture; toss gently to coat.

https://www.eatingwell.com/cabbage-salad.Title: Cabbage Salad with Apple, Walnuts & Gorgonzola
https://www.eatingwell.com/cabbage-salad.Description: This crisp and fresh cabbage-apple salad is combined with carrots, walnuts and creamy Gorgonzola cheese.
Ingredients: 4 cups chopped cabbage (such as napa, red or green)
1 cup thinly sliced unpeeled Honeycrisp apples
Instructions: Whisk chives, oil, vinegar, honey, mustard, pepper and salt together in a large bowl until well combined. Add cabbage, carrots, apples, walnuts and Gorgonzola; toss until well coated. Let stand, uncovered, tossing occasionally, until the cabbage is slightly softened, about 10 minutes for napa cabbage and 20 minutes for red and green cabbage. Additional reporting by Carrie Myers, M.S. and Linda Frahm

https://www.eatingwell.com/avocado-chick.Title: 5-Ingredient Avocado & Chickpea Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/avocado-chick.Description: This avocado and chickpea salad is a fresh, flavorful dish that comes together in minutes. Creamy avocado pairs perfectly with hearty chickpeas for a filling, plant-based meal.
Instructions: Whisk 4 tablespoons lemon juice, 2 tablespoons oil, ¼ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper in a large bowl. Add rinsed chickpeas, halved tomatoes, sliced onion and diced avocado; toss gently to coat.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/800443.Title: Kale, Quinoa & Apple Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/800443.Description: This kale, quinoa and apple salad is perfect for fall with fresh apples and kale which breaks down when it's massaged with the dressing.
Ingredients: 1 large bunch curly kale, stemmed and thinly sliced (about 8 cups)
2 medium Honeycrisp or Gala apples, unpeeled, roughly chopped
1 medium fennel bulb, cored and thinly sliced (3 cups)
2 cups cooked quinoa, at room temperature or chilled
Instructions: Whisk vinegar, maple syrup, salt and pepper together in a large bowl. Slowly drizzle in oil, whisking until combined. Add kale and massage into the dressing with clean hands until well coated and slightly tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Add apples, fennel and quinoa; toss until combined. Divide among 4 plates and top with almonds, cherries and blue cheese.

https://www.eatingwell.com/loaded-cabbag.Title: Loaded Cabbage Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/loaded-cabbag.Description: This loaded cabbage salad features crisp chopped green cabbage tossed in a creamy dressing flavored with smoky bacon.
Instructions: Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate. Reserve 1 tablespoon bacon fat; discard the rest. Chop the bacon when cool enough to handle.
Whisk sour cream, mayonnaise, vinegar, pepper, salt and the reserved bacon fat together in a large bowl. Add cabbage, carrot and scallions; toss to coat. Stir in cheese and the chopped bacon.

https://www.eatingwell.com/arugula-beet-.Title: Arugula, Beet & Feta Salad
https://www.eatingwell.com/arugula-beet-.Description: Peppery arugula and tender, sweet beets are balanced by a simple vinaigrette and briny bits of feta cheese in this salad.
Ingredients: ¼ teaspoon ground pepper, plus more for garnish
1 (8.8-ounce) package refrigerated cooked beets, such as Love Beets
Instructions: Stir sliced shallot, 3 tablespoons oil, 2 tablespoons vinegar, 2 teaspoons honey, ¼ teaspoon pepper and ⅛ teaspoon salt together in a large bowl until combined.
Drain beets and cut into 1-inch wedges; add to the dressing and toss to coat. Add arugula; toss gently to coat. Top with ½ cup feta and garnish with additional pepper, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/salmon-salad-.Title: Salmon Salad with Crispy White Beans
https://www.eatingwell.com/salmon-salad-.Description: This anti-inflammatory salmon salad with crispy white beans is a delicious meal that delivers big on flavor.
Ingredients: 1 (15-ounce) can no-salt-added cannellini beans, rinsed and patted dry
⅛ teaspoon salt plus ½ teaspoon, divided
1 pound skinless center-cut salmon fillet (about 1-inch thick), cut into 1-inch pieces
1 clove garlic, grated on a microplane
2 bunches lacinato kale, stemmed and coarsely chopped (about 8 packed cups)
1 small red bell pepper, thinly sliced
Instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F with racks in top third and lower third positions. Toss rinsed beans, 2 tablespoons olive oil and ½ teaspoon crushed red pepper together on a small rimmed baking sheet until evenly coated; spread in an even layer. Roast on the top rack, stirring once halfway through, until browned and crispy, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from oven; season with ⅛ teaspoon salt and set aside.

Toss salmon pieces, 2 tablespoons each shichimi togarashi and olive oil and the remaining ½ teaspoon salt together on a large rimmed baking sheet until evenly coated. Arrange along the outer edges of the baking sheet, evenly spaced apart. Roast on the bottom rack until browned and cooked through, about 8 minutes.

Meanwhile, whisk 2 tablespoons each rice vinegar and sesame oil, 2 teaspoons soy sauce, 1 teaspoon mustard, the grated garlic, ¼ teaspoon ginger and the remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil together in a large bowl; reserve ¼ cup of the vinaigrette for drizzling.

Add chopped kale to the large bowl with the remaining vinaigrette. With clean hands, massage the mixture until softened and reduced in volume by about half, about 2 minutes. Toss in sliced bell pepper and 1 cup carrots until evenly coated.
Divide the kale mixture among 4 bowls; top with salmon, crispy beans and ½ cup scallions. Drizzle with the reserved vinaigrette (1 tablespoon each).

https://www.eatingwell.com/garlicky-cabb.Title: The Best Gut-Healthy Soup
https://www.eatingwell.com/garlicky-cabb.Description: This garlicky cabbage soup is pure comfort in a bowl. Warm, hearty and nourishing, it's rich, with the aromatic flavor of garlic and tender-sweet cabbage.
Ingredients: 5 large cloves garlic, thinly sliced (3 tablespoons)
½ teaspoon ground pepper, plus more for garnish
4 cups reduced-sodium vegetable broth or no-chicken broth
2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill, plus more for garnish
Instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sliced garlic; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and fragrant but not browned, about 4 minutes. Add 4 cups cabbage, 1 teaspoon oregano and ½ teaspoon pepper; cook, stirring occasionally, until the cabbage starts to soften, about 3 minutes.
Add 4 cups broth and the rinsed beans; increase heat to high and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium, cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until the cabbage is tender, about 8 minutes.

Meanwhile, whisk ¼ cup Parmesan, 1 egg and 2½ tablespoons lemon juice in a medium heatproof bowl. While whisking constantly, drizzle about ½ cup of the hot soup broth into the egg mixture until completely incorporated. Repeat once more.
Remove the soup from the heat; whisk in the tempered egg mixture. Stir in 2 tablespoons dill and ¼ teaspoon salt. Divide among 4 bowls; garnish with additional dill, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/high-protein-.Title: High-Protein Pasta with Peas
https://www.eatingwell.com/high-protein-.Description: This high-protein pasta recipe uses chickpea pasta and peas to increase the protein content for a satisfying, one-pot dinner.
Ingredients: 2 medium shallots, finely chopped (about ⅔ cup)
4 large cloves garlic, finely chopped (about 2 tablespoons)
⅔ cup coarsely chopped fresh basil
¼ cup finely grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish
Instructions: Combine ⅓ cup pine nuts and 2 tablespoons oil in a large Dutch oven; cook over medium heat, stirring often, until the pine nuts are toasted and brown, 5 to 6 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the toasted pine nuts to a small bowl, reserving the oil in the pot.

Add chopped shallots, chopped garlic, ½ teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon pepper to the reserved oil in the Dutch oven. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring often, until softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in 12 ounces pasta and 4 cups water; bring to a boil over high heat, stirring occasionally. Reduce to a lively simmer; cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until the pasta is almost al dente, about 6 minutes (some liquid will remain).

Stir 10 ounces frozen peas into the pasta mixture; cook, uncovered, over medium-low heat, stirring often, until the peas are heated through and the pasta is al dente, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in ⅔ cup basil, ¼ cup Parmesan, 3 tablespoons pesto, 1 teaspoon lemon zest and 2 tablespoons lemon juice. Divide among 6 bowls and sprinkle with the reserved toasted pine nuts. Garnish with additional Parmesan, if desired.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/274850.Title: Ginger-Tahini Oven-Baked Salmon & Vegetables
https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/274850.Description: The tahini sauce does double duty in this healthy salmon recipe, serving as a glaze for the fish and also as a drizzle for the entire dish at the end of cooking. The green beans are cooked just slightly in this recipe, to still be crisp. If you like your green beans tenderer, look for thinner beans or haricot verts in the grocery store; they'll cook more quickly.
Ingredients: 1 pound white button or cremini mushrooms, cut into 1-inch pieces (6 cups)
